ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 inch piece ginger, peeled and minced
cooking_method:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the garlic and ginger to the pot and cook for an additional minute.
3. Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, paprika, garam masala, and salt to the pot. Stir to combine.
5. Add the water to the pot and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the curry simmer for 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Serve the chicken curry hot, garnished with cilantro.

ingredients: 1 pound fish fillet (any white fish), cut into bite-sized pieces
1 inch piece ginger, peeled and minced
cooking_method:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the garlic and ginger to the pot and cook for an additional minute.
3. Add the fish to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, paprika, garam masala, and salt to the pot. Stir to combine.
5. Add the water to the pot and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the curry simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Serve the fish curry hot, garnished with cilantro.

ingredients: A few drops of rose water
cooking_method:
1. Heat the milk in a large pot over medium heat. When it comes to a boil, turn off the heat and add the lemon juice.
2. Stir gently until the milk curdles and the whey separates from the curd.
3. Line a strainer with cheesecloth and strain the curdled milk. Rinse the curdled milk under cold water to remove any lemon flavor.
4. Gather the cheesecloth and squeeze out any remaining liquid. Hang the cheesecloth for 1 hour to drain any excess liquid.
5. In a separate pot, add the water, sugar, and cardamom pods. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes.
6. Add the cheese balls to the pot and cover with a lid. Cook for 10-12 minutes over medium-high heat until the balls have doubled in size.
7. Turn off the heat and let the Roshogolla cool to room temperature. Add a few drops of rose water and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.
